title: Ales Pushkin, jailed dissident artist in Belarus, dies at 57
description: Mr. Pushkin once dumped a pile of manure in front of the offices of Belarusian strongman Alexander Lukashenko.

title: Zelensky’s angry tweet on NATO membership nearly backfired
description: NATO policymakers in Vilnius considered diluting their invitation for Ukraine to join the bloc after Volodymyr Zelensky's blistering tweet, officials say.

title: Guatemala court suspends anti-corruption party before presidential election
description: The United States warned that the Central American country's democracy is again in peril.

title: Judges acquit janitor who groped student because it was under 10 seconds
description: Italians are using the hashtag #10secondi to protest a ruling that groping a student for up to 10 seconds wasn't long enough to constitute assault.

title: When the migrants vanished from this desert outpost, so did the jobs
description: The Nigerien city of Agadez had been counting on foreign aid to compensate. It didn’t.

title: Russia fires top commander in Ukraine who criticized Defense Ministry
description: Maj. Gen. Ivan Popov, a Russian commander in Ukraine, said he was removed after he “outlined all the problems existing in the army in terms of combat work and support.”

title: Blinken, China’s top diplomat discuss rivalry in effort to bolster ties
description: The conversation between the senior diplomats continues a flurry of high-level contact between the United States and China that began last month with Blinken’s trip to Beijing.

title: North Korea’s latest ballistic missile just keeps getting better
description: This week's Hwasong-18 intercontinental ballistic missile flew twice as high as the previous one, and three minutes longer too. Experts say that's significant.

title: Birds are using anti-bird spikes to fortify nests in ‘perfect comeback’
description: Research in Europe shows birds are protecting their nests with spikes installed on buildings to prevent them from perching.

title: Fire in Naples devours huge artwork by Italian artist, arson suspected
description: “Venus of the Rags” has been praised for the visceral way it conveys the perils of waste. But not everyone loved the towering Venus and her mountain of trash.

title: A firefighter broke a world record for farthest run — while on fire
description: French firefighter and stuntman Jonathan Vero broke a Guinness World Record for the fastest 100-meter sprint and the farthest run while on fire.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky expresses optimism on NATO membership after summit
description: Ukraine’s president said the NATO summit dispelled any doubts about Kyiv’s future membership in the alliance, after initially criticizing a lack of a timeline.

title: Russia’s war might have a new casualty: The Putin-Erdogan bond
description: In Russia, the sense that Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan may be pivoting to a closer relationship with Western leaders seemed to provoke almost as much anxiety as the idea of Sweden joining NATO.

title: Zelensky’s ‘guilt-based’ diplomacy leaves its mark on NATO summit
description: In a stroke of “guilt-based” diplomacy, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky blasted NATO leaders for not giving Ukraine an invitation or clear timeline for accession into the alliance.
